title: Technical Lead - Adobe Experience Manager
description:
As a Technical Lead, you will be responsible for the analysis, definition, architecture, design, construction, testing, installation, modification, and maintenance of properly engineered information systems to meet agreed business needs: 

  • Design and  Implement – by understanding the business needs, defining solution architecture/design, conducting functional validation, reviewing construction and executing full Agile from design through release. Ensure completed modules provide all functionality described by application experts and operation ready meeting all non-functional requirements. 
  • Be a Technical Leader: effectively contribute to Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) enterprise-level ecosystem in development, technical oversight, and enterprise systems integrations. Design and develop technical approaches and solutions and provide recommendations on building effectively on the AEM platform. Provide coaching and technical oversight to the development team around analysis, development and unit testing of modules & artifacts developed on AEM. 
  • Be a Team Player – work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, interact with customer, partner with cross functional and remote teams. Provide analysis and design reviews to other members and groups within the department to avoid duplication of efforts in solving the same application problem within different products.  
  • Be Curious & Innovative – continuously update yourself with next generation technology, development tools, and contribute to process development practices. Evaluate new technologies and software products to determine feasibility and desirability of incorporating capabilities within the company's products.  
  • Be an Agile Person – with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines, drive backlog planning and scrums 
  • Be an Effective Communicator – articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer-reviews/design review boards, and exhibit strong listening skills 
  • Focus on Continuous Improvement and Technical Standards – Drive improvements in productivity, architecture for software development, prepare technical specifications and, leverage development best practices as a part of daily responsibilities like code review, build and release etc.  
  • Take Ownership – responsible for E2E delivery, develop estimates from delivery/architecture, lead geographically distributed teams, create and maintain project documentation, monitor risks/mitigation strategies with stakeholders and strive for improving efficiency of the solutions 

About You 

You are fit for the role of a Digital  Technology Lead - Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) if you have: 

Basic qualifications: 

  • 6+ years of experience handling and leading development projects involving Adobe Experience Manager – recent experience with AEM 6.5 or higher versions.  
  • Strong Knowledge of architecture & infrastructure considerations for AEM Sites and AEM Assets
  • Proficiency in using modern AEM artifacts for content and experience exchange leveraging Content Fragment Models, Content Fragments and Experience Fragments  
  • Strong technical foundation of AEM and web content management design and development including AEM Sites, AEM Assets, Web Components in HTL, Editable Templates, Sling Models, Workflows , Backend Java OSGI Services , JCR and JCX
  • Experience in multiple front-end web technologies including HTML/5, CSS, JavaScript, and Responsive Web technologies  
  • Knowledge of developing on AEM following principles of ReactJS Framework and leveraging the AEM SPA Editor  
  • Strong working knowledge with Analysis, Design, and Implementation including SOA, Web services, XML/HTTP, REST HTML, Servlets and APIs 
  • Proficiency in Apache Sling, JCR Repository and Apache Felix OSGi Framework  
  • Experience in using AEM Multisite Manager (MSM) for creating multilingual websites and store fronts 
  • Knowledge of Digital Asset Management (DAM) concepts to effectively leverage AEM Assets
  • Experience in using AEM Translation framework  
  • Knowledge of functional, security and performance testing processes, tools and methods 

Preferred qualifications: 

  • Experience in working with Adobe Cloud Manager, XML DITA add-on (AEM Guides), Adobe Managed Services and Cloud (AWS)  
  • Experience building Customer service and support portals like Help center, Training etc..
  • Adobe certifications

title: Digital Marketer
description:
Digital Marketer, Operations Customer Service & Support

About the Role

In this opportunity as Digital Marketer, you will: 

  • Consult and develop overarching digital marketing plans, process and implementation for all digital assets: website, email, blog, video, social media and app platforms

  • Identify target audiences and devise digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivate

  • Create digital assets with team including landing pages, emails that effectively support marketing plan tactics, campaign strategies, and follow brand standards

  • Analyze data to help shape future marketing strategies

  • Contribute to processes that help enhance structures and process improvements in digital marketing prioritization, measurement and deployment

About You 

You're a fit for the role of Digital Marketer if your background includes: 

  • Having significant knowledge of Digital Marketing including SEO, social media, and local search.  

  • Familiarity with web analytics tools including: Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, SpyFu, Screaming Frog. 

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  

  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience or equivalent education in Digital Marketing strategies and tactics. 

  • Bachelor's degree required. Business or Marketing preferred.

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Event Specialist - Brand Marketing
description:
The Event Specialist role is a key support function for the Enterprise Sponsorship & Events team. Effectively supporting the Events team by coordinating attendee registration platform, financial, and meeting logistics and processes ensuring all aspects of the events are planned, defined, and executed to the highest of standards. The ability to work as an enterprise, global event team member is essential as the role involves supporting global colleagues to ensure visibility and sharing of best practices.  

About the role:

As event specialist we do:

  • Manage online attendee registration database using the Certain platform; including the website build, managing changes, associated maintenance, reporting, and the Thomson Reuters Event support email inbox.   

  • Coordinate all Finance/Accounts Payable requirements; submit all invoices, POs, credit card transactions, and record/report in Smartsheet project management tool 

  • Tracking budget for all events and processing event invoice and expense reports in compliance with company policies. 

  • Mobile Event App (Spot Me and/or Certain Touchpoint); database management of the project plan and populate content for the mobile event app. 

  • Education/Training Session management for SYNERGY Conferences, and database management. 

  • Ability to plan and execute events with responsibility for end-to-end delivery and execution with (at times) little to no supervision.  

  • Ensure creative execution of meetings/events as directed by the event/program management committees. Establish the appropriate tools and processes to meet project goals. Influence event/program stakeholders to make the appropriate decisions and modifications in response to external influences on the event/program. 

  • Researching event venues and costs for proposed events, researching branding items and gifts for guests. 

  • Creation of event project plans and run of events for all associated events. Comfortable using technology tools, such as event registration software, internal websites, and social media to allow for better team documentation, collaboration, and knowledge exchange. 

  • Participate in or conduct event debriefs following each event and ensure written feedback is documented back to the teams and participants to improve future events. 

  • Perform other assignments as requested by manager. 

About you:

You are a good fit if you have:

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred. Equivalent applicable experience may be considered. 

  • 1-3+ years of events experience with either a corporate or business events team.  

  • Proficiency in reading, writing and speaking English  

  • Experience working in a fast-paced, complex, and dynamic environment.  

  • Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel and other MS (Microsoft) Office Tools (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook). 

  • Experience with event technology and tools (i.e., Smartsheet project management tool, Certain/CVENT attendee registration platform, Spot Me/Certain Touchpoint mobile event apps). 

  • Solid experience with logistics involved with event planning and ability to drive and manage projects to the satisfaction of multiple stakeholders. 

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Marketer, Campaign Management - Marketing Corporates
description:
As a Marketer, Campaign Management, you will help the team test, activate and optimize digital-first marketing programming to fuel continued growth in Thomson Reuters.  The Campaign Management team owns a wide range of essential activities necessary to execute on acquisition, retention, cross-sell, upsell, and pipeline acceleration programs, while keeping TR customers front and center.  

About the role:

As a marketer, campaign management you will be responsible of: 

  • Collaborate with campaign planning teams on activation and optimization of quarterly campaign plans to meet retention, upsell, cross sell and acquisition targets. 

  • Audit lead flows and programming to ensure streamlined processes and increased speed. 

  • Conduct campaign analysis and package data pulls to fuel optimization and best practices. 

  • Evaluate and report on campaign and channel/tactical performance, continually optimizing to hit KPIs 

  • Closely monitor and measure programming to ensure we are achieving highest possible ROI  

  • Creatively problem solve and dig into all areas of demand gen workflow to ensure smooth and timely program execution 

  • Act as liaison with US central and partner teams to ensure consistent processes, accountabilities, and deliverables. 

 

Accountability  

  • Delivery of effective marketing funnel, from lead to closed sale 

  • Manage SLAs across US central teams 

  • Maintain or exceed quality expectations 

About you:

You will be an excellent fit if you have:

  • BA or BS degree required 

  • 2+ years of experience in marketing and campaign coordination  

  • Strong digital marketing experience and knowledge, especially in B2B and e-commerce space 

  • Strong project management skills; outstanding communicator 

  • Ability to manage multiple campaign plans and stakeholders simultaneously 

  • Strong analytical/data-gathering background, using tools such as Salesforce, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, etc. to determine performance 

  • Strong collaboration, teamwork and relationship building skills  

  • Skilled at learning and leveraging new tools, processes, and systems (e.g. Workfront and Anaplan) 

  • Good understanding of modern demand generation technologies and systems 

  • Passion for accurate follow-through of program details (while still maintaining team speed) 

  • Team player with track record of proactively helping teams achieve objectives 

  • Experience in a matrixed organization or agency experience preferred 

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Director, Global Sales - Global Large Law Firms
description:
The Director of Global Sales for GLLF is responsible for effectively leading and executing go-to-market sales strategy across the Practice of Law teams, including content and software. This individual will lead and coach a direct sales team of Senior Sales Executives and the Manager, Global Sales. This is accomplished through an in-depth understanding of Thomson Reuters products, sales techniques appropriate for shortening sales cycles in an enterprise selling environment, and the needs of legal professionals in order to bundle information solutions to meet broader firm needs.

About the Role:

In this role as Director of Global Sales you will:

  • Reinforce and model a collaborative, innovative and bold culture across GLLF teams globally and removes obstacles

  • Develop talent and hold team accountable

  • Influence and drive change

About You

You're a fit for the Director of Global Sales if you have:

  • Proven sales leadership with management experience across content, software and technology teams

  • Strong negotiation skills and a track record of executing sales process, with a focus on prospecting, discovery and tactical

  • Effective coaching skills for lead generation, opportunity creation and pipeline management and proven success at shortening sales cycles

  • Ability to lead teams across complex deal structures, as well as serve in customer-facing capacity, when needed

  • Strong communication and commercial and financial acumen

  • Demonstrable knowledge of attorney workflow, global law firm strategies and org structure & overall legal market

What's in it for you?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: Sales Executive, Digital Marketing (Madison WI)
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world class company that is market leading for both content and technology? Does hearing that we are completely committed to organic growth and that we have extensive investments to expand our sales capability excite you? Do you have previous experience driving sales and revenue growth within a specific territory? Are you motivated by uncapped commissions? We are looking for you!

What You’ll Do: As a Sales Executive you will be responsible for developing and growing new customer accounts in the legal community within an assigned territory.  Each territory consists of a large base of small/mid-sized firms. You will utilize your prospecting and consultative selling skills, high energy and initiative to identify opportunities to provide FindLaw web-based marketing and advertising solutions.  You will also be responsible to partner with our internal Account Management team related to the post-sales satisfaction and retention of existing FindLaw customers. 

About the Role:

  • Responsible for the attainment of sales targets and quota on a monthly basis in assigned territory.
  • Consult with the client regarding web-based marketing strategies and solutions that will meet their business needs and will improve their ability to generate business.
  • Strategically grow a customer base through prospecting and cold calling. 
  • Technical aptitude (MS Office, internet applications, Salesforce.com).
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders regarding existing and new clients to identify and resolve client concerns; establish and maintain current and potential client relationships. 

About You:

Experience:

  • 4-year college degree or equivalent experience.
  • Experience in outside sales in a professional B2B environment.
  • Proven track record of sales success, fast growth and consistently achieving performance at 100%+.
  • Previous sales experience in online/advertising environment a plus. 

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Working knowledge of sales process, methods and techniques.
  • Strong Interpersonal skills, ability to interpret marketplace needs and translate them into products and/or services.
  • Proven organization skills, effective time management skills and ability to work independently

Travel:

  • Ability to be actively in the field on most business days with some overnight travel based on territory to various client sites.

What’s in it For You?

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

·       Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

·       Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

·       Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

·       Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

·       Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

·       Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Executivo de Vendas - Segmento Varejo
description:
Executivo de Vendas – Segmento Varejo 

 

Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Executivo de Vendas em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós! 

 

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios. 

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão. 

 

 

Sobre a Posição  

 

Nesta oportunidade, como Executivo de Vendas, você irá: 

  •  Construir relacionamentos com clientes com contas novas e atuais. Orquestra as vendas e renovações
  • Essa posição geralmente gerencia um conjunto de contas nomeadas e é responsável pelo aumento da receita e pela maximização da satisfação do cliente
  • Desenvolve e mantém relacionamentos com clientes para impulsionar o crescimento da receita
  • Profissional Hunter responsável pelo segmento de varejo
  • Gestão da carteira de clientes território nacional
  • Gestão de grandes contas
  • Trabalhar com metas de vendas
  • Gerenciamento de contas e parceiros

 

Sobre Você 

 

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:  

  • Graduação completa
  • Experiência com vendas de soluções (Preferencialmente fiscal)
  • Desejável experiência no segmento de Varejo/Retail
  • Disponibilidade para trabalhar híbrido em São Paulo – Capital

 

O que iremos te oferecer 

 

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de: 

 

·       Medidas contra a COVID-19: Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19. 

·       Cultura: Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais. 

·       Wellbeing: benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; aposentadoria, poupança, reembolso de mensalidades e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro 

·       Learning & Development: Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters 

·       Impacto Social: Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global. 

·       Trabalho com propósitos específicos: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.   

 

Remuneração: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.

title: Associate Sales Executive
description:
Associate Sales Executive

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading or both content and technology? If yes, we’re looking for you.

We’re looking for experienced Sales Reps to join our sales team. As an Associate Sales Executive, you will be responsible for inbound and outbound calls in your respective territory to find new business through targeted campaigns.

About the Role

In this opportunity as an Associate Sales Executive, you will: 

  • Sell TR Legal products and services to new prospects.
  • Discuss the use of products, emphasizing product features based on analyses of customers' needs and technical knowledge of product capabilities
  • Maintain activity level of 70+ customer calls/emails per day
  • Continuously work with management to refine sales strategy to optimize efficiency and results and initiate sales campaigns to meet sales expectations
  • Learn and thoroughly understand our products and services.
  • Learn and thoroughly understand our target market and prospect’s profiles
  • Understand how Legal (OLI) products are used in the corporates small and medium business market to better present and sell our Legal products to meet the customers' needs
  • Negotiate and close new business
  • Meet or exceed assigned monthly & yearly quotas
  • Ensure an accurate and timely process for maintaining customer account information and closing pricing transactions
  • Maintain accurate and timely customer information with Sales Operations, Customer Service, and Technical Support groups.
  • Load and manage customer and lead data in CRM tools

About You

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

  • Bachelor’s degree or 2+ years of successful professional sales experience in a related environment:  Business-to-business preferred // Sales to U.S.A or Canada preferred (not a MUST)
  • Ability to utilize effective selling skills
  • Must be driven, competitive, passionate and achievement-oriented, and motivated by success
  • Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales quota target
  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Ability to quickly learn technical content in nature and be able to explain and communicate value propositions in English effectively
  • Effective CRM tools usage knowledge
  • Effective time management skills
  • Legal background preferred (not a MUST).

Compensation: Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

Location: CDMX

#LI-ZM1

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • COVID-19 Response: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
  • Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Finance Internship – Summer 2023
description:
Finance Internship – Summer 2022

Primary Location: Eagan, MN, US

Are you looking for an internship that provides real-world-project experience, networking with employees and executives worldwide, while growing your talents on a supportive and inclusive team? If so, we want to connect with you! 

Thomson Reuters is a leading provider of business information services. Our products include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news service – Reuters. By joining us, you will make your mark in one of WayUp’s Top 100 Internship Programs of 2021, working on industry-leading products with opportunities for networking, volunteering, and social events!

About the Role

At Thomson Reuters we are focused on building an inclusive culture of world-class talent. The Finance Internship is a robust 12-week program designed to give interns real-world, applicable, professional experience by working on specific projects and being involved in day to day operations just as a full-time employee would be expected. As part of the internship program you will be provided both personal and professional growth opportunities including:

  • Project-Based Experience: Provide analysis and recommendations around a specific project. Examples of past projects include:
    • Developed a sales performance dashboard to identify and target the most beneficial incentives to accelerate revenue growth
    • Constructed and analyzed full P&L views for several products and recommended actions to improve profitability
    • Created an operating model to integrate and track performance of recent acquisitions
  • Training: Technical, systems, and soft skill training
  • Networking: Lunch and learn sessions with various leaders across the organization along with conversations with other interns, professionals, and senior management
  • Real-World Exposure: Job shadows and 1:1 lunches with former interns and finance leaders

About You

You’re a fit for a Finance Intern if you:

  • Are achieving a bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Analytics, Data Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Economics, or Statistics (Graduation date December 2022 to May 2023)
  • Encompass strong business and financial acumen, data analysis, and analytical skills
  • Demonstrate leadership and effective communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills
  • Work comfortably in a team environment with changing priorities and time pressures 
  • Can be an agile learner, demonstrate strong decision-making skills, and act with integrity

What’s in it For You?

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. We offer an enriched internship program that focuses on developing the next generation of talent.  Bringing your whole self to work is at our core. Here’s how we support your growth:

  • Campus Culture: WayUp’s Top 100 Internship Programs for 2021, intern-focused events, weekly social hours, a dedicated intern appreciation day, Fireside Chats, partnerships with Business Resource Groups, & recognized company culture awarded for our diversity and inclusion 
  • Learning & Development: Project-based internship related to your degree, networking with colleagues and executive leaders across the globe, intern alumni panels, Executive Speaker Series, Thomson Reuters University and LinkedIn Learning skills academies, mentorship from managers and teams.
  • Compensation: Competitively paid internships, full-time hours Monday to Friday, with company-designated holidays 
  • Social Impact: Intern volunteer days, local volunteer events impacting your community  
  • Purpose-Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Senior Sales Executive: HighQ
description:
The Medium Law Firm Senior Sales Executive: HighQ is responsible for selling HighQ and Document Intelligence to the legal community within an assigned territory. This individual will leverage their expert consultative sales approach and honed professional demeanor to effectively manage complex relationships, while capitalizing on opportunities within Medium Law accounts. This is accomplished through an in-depth understanding of the needs of the legal profession, sales techniques appropriate for a long sales cycle and the legal tech industry in order to identify solutions to meet broad firm needs.

About the Role:

As a Senior Sales Executive, you will:

  • Drive Results: Identifies the best channel for engagement with customers, defaulting to virtual for the majority of deals where value is insufficient to warrant travel; Support in developing and executing territory growth strategies

  • Closing: Prospect new customers, validate their needs, shape product plans and drive deals to close

  • Relationship Management: Focus on new logo acquisition and mid-contract upsell/cross-sell opportunities and renewals

  • Product Proposition: Possess core knowledge across HighQ and Document Intelligence and engage Solutions Consultants where deep product expertise is required to drive to close

  • Reporting: Utilize an automated and insight-driven Salesforce workflow to progress deals; KPI's include: Nurturing opportunities and moving more complex sales to close, i.e. New logo sales and existing ‘non-named’ account incremental sales

  • Client & Market Intelligence: Understand specific customer archetypes and needs which are most prevalent within the sub-segment and territory

About You:

You're a fit for the Senior Sales Executive if you have/are:

  • Minimum 5 years successful sales experience in a consultative selling environment to C-level players

  • 4 year college degree required

  • Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques

  • Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation

  • Excellent communication skills and closing skills

  • Effective time management skills

  • Able to work from home office and travel to customer locations

  • Proficient in MS Office/Internet

  • Working knowledge of legal tech industry, experience selling into large law accounts, and strong knowledge and background in the legal profession and/or legal publishing industry preferred

  • High level of competency with regard to internet, periodical and internal prospecting

  • Proficient database management skills

  • Law degree preferred

  • Able to travel as required

What's in it for you?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines

  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

  • Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world

title: Content Specialist
description:
Legal Content Editor | Content Operations

The Legal Content Editor participates in an Editorial or Content Operations team and assists in the creation and/or acquisition, preparation and delivery of assigned content and information for creating products and product functionality in all publication media (print or electronic).

About the Role

In this opportunity as Legal Content Editor, you will:

  • Publishing: Performs duties such as analyzing, keying, converting, coding, copyreading, editing, merging, rendering, loading, or validation of data.
  • Creating direct history relationships between court orders. Direct History is the course of a proceeding through the appellate process and indicates the relationship between decisions in the same litigation. Over 2000 direct history codes are used to describe the various relationships between decisions.
  • Supports team publishing goals by meeting deadlines.
  • Quality Control: Responsible for accuracy and completeness of work product. All work will be checked until competent process knowledge is developed.
  • Individual and Team Skills: Attends and participates in team meetings, prioritizes own work, and participates in the performance management process (e.g. peer reviews, self-evaluation).

About You

You are fit for the role Legal Content Editor if you have/if you are:

  • Strong English language skills, including college level vocabulary, spelling, punctuation and grammar and sentence structure.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with internal and/or external contacts.
  • Skilled in the use of personal computers and familiarity with multiple software packages, including word processing and file management applications.
  • Ability to prioritize and stay focused while dealing with multiple assignments.
  • Detail-oriented with an aptitude for analysis and problem solving on an individualized level and within the context of a team environment.
  • Ability to successfully work in a team environment.
  • Candidates must be willing to work on a hybrid set up.
  • Must be a Bachelor of Laws/J.D.
  • Must be willing to work on the AM shift
  • Open to Fresh Law Graduates

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • Hybrid Work Model: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, we are embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance; work from anywhere (in country); caregiver paid time off, bereavement leave; company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees - Thomson Reuters café networking.
  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: Assistente de Conteúdo
description:
Assistente de Conteúdo, Latam - Legal

Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Assistente de Conteúdo em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

Sobre a Posição

Nesta oportunidade, como Assistente de Conteúdo, você irá:

  • Extrair informações publicadas no diário oficial referente a andamento de processos e incluir em sistema (Legal One), através de ferramentas internas garantindo que o conteúdo jurídico seja assertivo e atualizado em tempo real
  • Atuar junto ao time trabalhando pra padronizar informações garantindo que uploads e downloads sejam verificados com qualidade para manter o serviço de satisfação do cliente     

Sobre Você

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

  • Graduado e/ou graduando em Direito, Engenharia ou Análise e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas
  • Domínio do pacote office
  • Disponibilidade de atuação híbrida (2x na semana no escritório)
  • Senso de urgência, dinamismo, gestão de tempo, visão sistêmica                                                       
  • Vivência em Power BI
  • Inglês Intermediário
  • Conhecimento em Linguagem Natural (Python)
  • Agilidade

O que iremos te oferecer

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

  • Medidas contra a COVID-19: Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
  • Cultura: Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
  • Wellbeing: benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; parcerias e programas de incentivo aos colaboradores para realização de cursos necessários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
  • Learning & Development: Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters
  • Impacto Social: Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
  • Trabalho com propósitos específicos: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.  

Remuneração: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.

title: Payroll Specialist with French
description:
About the Role

You will join the team of 12 colleagues based in Gdansk. You will deliver services in a manner that is service oriented and consistent with established payroll policies, processes and business requirements.


The jobholder is responsible for providing quality service to our customers and partner groups including employees, payroll providers, local authorities and internal stakeholders.
 

About You
In this opportunity as Payroll Specialist, you will: 

  • Processing EMEA Payroll data input via the payroll provider platform
  • Extracting data from HR system of record & data input on to the Payroll Platform directly including: New Starters, Leavers, One Time Payments, Overtime, Salary Changes, etc.
  • Ensuring Payroll is processed accurately within agreed deadlines
  • Liaising with key business stakeholders
  • Resolving all queries from employees via Payroll Helpdesk in a timely manner
  • Sending Statutory forms to Payroll Vendor within agreed deadlines
  • Responding to HR and employees requests and queries
  • Performing ad hoc activities related to assigned payroll group

 

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Payroll Specialist if you:

  • Language skills - English and French (additional European language will be an advantage: Italian, Spanish)
  • BA or MS degree preferred in Finance, Business Management, HR or Analytics
  • Interest in payroll processes, general understanding of payroll environment
  • Advanced in Excel
  • Strong problem solving, decision making and analytical skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication; both oral and written
  • Proven ability to sustain strong customer relationships, an understanding of customer focus and service delivery
  • Ability to deliver results in a fast-paced environment with attention to details
  • Drive & self-motivation with the ability to work independently
  • Working knowledge of Workday/ CloudPay/ SAP is a plus

What’s in it For You?

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Our Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
  • Social Impact: Two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: Ejecutivo de Ventas Senior
description:
Territory Manager para Thomson Reuters Argentina

¡Queremos que seas parte de nuestro equipo de SMB Sales en Thomson Reuters Argentina!

Buscamos una persona proactiva acostumbrada a trabajar por objetivos individuales y grupales. Que use su experiencia para conducir conversaciones exploratorias que le permitan identificar las necesidades del usuario.

Si te apasionan las ventas, la tecnología y el marketing digital esta es tu oportunidad de un nuevo desafío en una compañía tech. Aportar conocimiento e ideas, ser parte de un equipo de alto rendimiento y crecer profesionalmente junto a personas que aman lo que hacen.

¿Cuáles son las principales responsabilidades?

  • Desarrollar nuevos negocios
  • Realizar venta consultiva de nuestros productos intangibles tanto de forma telefónica o presencial
  • Brindar demostraciones de los productos
  • Prospección de nuevos clientes para ampliar cartera asignada
  • Manejo y mantenimiento de cartera de clientes asignada

Requisitos de la posición:

  • Poseer experiencia en ventas consultivas / intangibles (mínimo 2 años)
  • Conocimientos de procesos administrativos
  • Manejo de CRM (Salesforce deseable)
  • Graduados de Cs. Económicas / Sistemas (deseable)
  • Conocimientos de Office, especialmente Excel
  • Idioma inglés (deseable)

¿Qué te proponemos?

🕑 Modalidad de trabajo híbrido (flexibilidad)
🏥 Pre paga para vos y tu grupo familiar primario
💰 Subsidio internet mensual
🚀 Flex my way (trabajá desde donde quieras dentro del pais – 8 semanas al año)
🍀 Days off anuales (mental health – programa de Wellbeing)
🎁 Day off cumpleaños
🍴 Servicio de vending in office
🏃 Gympass (red de gimnasios)
⌨ Allowance Home Office (one time) – compra de equipamiento
🌅 Viernes flex de verano

title: Global Trade Analyst - Python
description:
Are you excited about working at the forefront of applied research in an industry setting? Thomson Reuters Labs in Hyderabad is seeking experienced data scientists with a passion for solving problems using state-of-the-art Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.

About the role

Participates in an Editorial or Content Operations team and assist in the creation and/or acquisition, preparation and delivery of assigned content and information for creating products and product functionality. The primary focus at this entry level is training with some supervision. Develop to build, implement, and maintain Python software modules- typically consisting largely of features of web scraping and data management. Responsible to run workflows, audits files and delegate files to destination in timely manner. Responsible to maintain proper reporting. Partially responsible to validate Global Trade Content data.

Responsibilities:

  • Experiment & Development
    • Work with a small team or individually as required, to design programs, code and implement them
    • Communicate with users, cross functional teams to understand requirements and come up with solutions
    • Test the codes before deployment on a larger scale
    • Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing codes and software modules
    • Create technical documentation for reference and reporting
    • Work on assigned projects based on the needs of the department.
  • Collaborate: Working on a collaborative cross-functional team, you will share information, value diverse ideas, and partner effectively with colleagues across the globe. You will elevate and mentor teammates.
  • Deliver: With a strong sense of urgency and the desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will translate complex business problems into projects with clearly defined scope. Our problems are complex; our solutions are right-sized. You will be accountable for timely, well-managed deliverables.
  • Innovate:  You will be empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will implement innovative ideas to solve real-world challenges.
  • Inspire: You will be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work. You will be articulate and compelling in describing ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will help lead the way in the adoption of AI across the enterprise.

Qualification : Fresher/ 1 years experience (Python programming ,web scrapping)

Requirements:

  • Exceptional attitude towards customer service
  • Excellent analytical & interpretation skills to support global trade operations
  • Familiarity with excel formulas and macros
  • Ability to read & interpret process documents
  • Familiarity with coding and developing concepts
  • Basic knowledge of Python
  • Experience with Python, Pandas or Selenium is a plus
  • Ability to learn new technologies- platforms, languages, libraries, APIs
  • Resourcefulness and troubleshooting aptitude
  • Strong motivation/curiosity to improve established processes

What's in it for you

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. In addition to rewarding and challenging work with exceptional colleagues, we offer the following benefits for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology
    • Our Scientists and Engineers get to play with big data sets to discover new products, capabilities, and insights for our customers. Thomson Reuters is most well-known for the globally respected Reuters News agency, but our company is also the leading source of information for legal, corporate and tax professionals. We have over 60,000 TBs worth of legal, regulatory, news, and tax data. 
  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage effective day one, savings and investment plans
  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs
  • Social Impact: Paid time off for volunteering virtually or in your community

title: QA Lead Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality. 
QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. 
QA role plays an important part in our company’s product development process.
Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets client needs, 
while being cost-effective. If you hold an engineering background and enjoy providing end-to-end solutions to software quality problems,
 we’d like to meet you.


Lead team of technical QA automation members
8+ years of work experience
High proficiency in computer technology and programming languages
Strong knowledge of Linux and Microsoft Windows
Solid knowledge of and practical experience in Web UI Automated Testing
Provides input for the planning, integration, casing, scripting, and execution of all testing required of a single software change or project.
Development/Improvement of test automation framework using Selenium WebDriver/Selenium Grid/Java/Test NG/SQL/RestAssured/Jenkins.
Contribute towards writing of automation scripts of manual test cases and tasks across all projects in multiple technologies.
Implement and manage continuous automated testing integration using Jenkins.
Executes test scripts/cases and communicates the results of testing.
Innovate and create utilities that helps to drive test automation effectively.
Leverages technical solutions on assigned projects.
May lead project sub team.
Stays current with industry trends and identifies technologies that will impact the business.
Conducts root cause analysis and correlation of other system and/or problems of moderate complexity.
Estimates effort required for own work
Identifies risk, comes up with mitigation plans, and implements the same.
Reports progress on problem resolution to management.
Recommends improvements to the testing processes to create efficiencies.
Provide training to other members as needed.
In-depth understanding of Java8 or above, Selenium WebDriver, Selenium Grid, Jenkins, Maven, Report Portal, TestNG/Junit, AWS, MS Teams, BDD, Cucumber JVM, Kanban
Understanding of the TAF structure, design patterns in automated testing
Experience with WS API (REST) testing, HTTP/HTTPs protocols
Experience in MS TFS as a source control and defect management system.
Experience with Web API Automated testing.
Experience with Apache Ant + Ivy
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
Hands-on experience with automated testing tools
Knowledge in functional testing, testing theory
Troubleshooting skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Experience working in Agile/Scrum development process and CI development practice
Regular upgrade to higher version of Jenkins\Report Portal; ( after new version will be released - need to valuate importance of changes in new version to make decision about upgrade
Regular upgrade and patching of servers ( every month servers need to be upgraded according to rules, after notification 
Password rotation ( reactivation of service accounts 1 in 3 month and update in services)
Monitoring\alerting of environments stability;
Access of infrastructure usage to check some down times to make redundancies of costs (dataDog monitoring tool);
Troubleshooting in case of env issues based on monitoring\alerting (dataDog tool) or some team side request (excluding automation test issues troubleshooting);
Smoke test run on regular basis to make sure that all servers and tools up and runing;
DB maintenance and regular updating ( including backups checking (for Jenkins\Report Portal and their DBs));
TLS certificates rotation ( need to validate with security team);

title: Software QA Engineer
description:
• Provides the planning, integration, casing, scripting, and execution of all testing required of a single software change or project or program.
  • Independently develops test plan documents, writes and executes automation scripts, manual test cases etc. Provides guidance to less experienced staff for the above.
  • Reviews business requirements, and design specifications complex changes/systems for completeness and testability.
  • Conducts testing using company-specific, manual, programmatic or automated processes.
  • Develops and executes test scripts, lead bug triage meetings, coordinate with the development teams, and communicate on Testing status and Test Results, all independently.
  • Typically spends time doing "hands on" work such as producing design documents, reviewing deliverables and making code changes on complex modules
  • Develops software to test Applications.
  • Logs defects per defined project guidelines and standards and analyzes defects including the origin and cause, communicates pertinent information, and confirms resolution of defects.
  • Provides subject matter expertise across sub-units.
  • Gives advice to middle management on functional matters, or on the interpretation of policies and practices.
  • May have some responsibility for managing third party deliveries.
  • Leverages technical solutions across multiple projects
  • Stays current with industry trends and identifies technologies that will impact the business.
  • May lead a small group on implementing projects with manageable risks and resources requirements.
  • Conducts root cause analysis and correlation of other system and/or problems of high complexity.
  • Works on medium to large, moderately complex projects/issues that require increased skill in multiple technical environments and disciplines.
  • Typically works on one project at a time and as the leader of one or more small-medium technical team
  • Works on projects of varying complexity including very large and complex projects that require increased skill in multiple technical disciplines.
  • Estimates effort required for own work and checks and agrees other team members' estimates.
  • Accountable for planning work assigned to their team, including work breakdown, accurate estimate and identification of possible solution options.
  • Accountable for tracking status of team's work and ensuring deliverables are produced on agreed schedules.
  • Identifies risk, comes up with mitigation plan, communicates the same, and develops and escalation process.
  • Responsible for communicating accurately the status of ongoing work to stakeholders
  • Recommends improvements to the testing processes to create efficiencies.
  • Software Process:
  • Prepare SQA plans for projects according to documented procedure.
  • Works with the software project during its early stages to establish plans, standards, and procedures.
  • Reviews projects software engineering activity to verify compliance.
  • Audits designated software work products to verify compliance.
  • Implements collection of software metrics.
  • Escalates software process issues to appropriate levels of management.

title: Stakeholder Engagement Manager
description:
Roles and Responsibilities

  • Create an overarching engagement program for Employee Technology Services – including change management and communication strategies that merge critical business and technical needs and requirements to foster faster and seamless adoption of new technologies and ways of working.
  • Works across the business and technology teams to develop content and leads/facilitates multiple channels and activities for various stakeholder groups to create awareness, share needs, solicit and incorporate client, partner and user feedback – including leadership forums, technology conferences, and “user first” communities in in-person and virtual settings.
  • Build and oversee a matrixed group of “ambassadors” across the TR enterprise to create awareness and promote adoption of new products and functionality.
  • Develop communication and change management guidelines to ensure consistency in messaging to internal and external stakeholders
  • Provide an internal consulting service for projects and teams requiring advice on stakeholder engagement/plans communication tools and processes for specific initiatives.

title: S2P Solutions Architect
description:
• Work with business/service owners to translate requirements into actionable architectures and with technology teams to implement them. 
  • Develop and document technical solutions for TR procurement function based on SAP Ariba and related technologies.
  • Research and recommend technical standards and best practices relating to SAP Ariba technologies. 
  • Identifying business/project risk and mitigating/communicating as needed.
  • Create and maintain a detailed view of existing architecture, to support operations and transition to future state architecture.

  • Work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, consider diverse ideas, and partner with cross-functional and remote teams.

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
You will join the team of around 12 colleagues based in Gdansk. You will deliver services in a manner that is service oriented and consistent with established payroll policies, processes and business requirements.

The jobholder is responsible for providing quality service to our customers and partner groups including employees, payroll providers, local authorities and internal stakeholders.

About the Role

In this opportunity as Payroll Specialist, you will:

  • Processing EMEA Payroll data input via the payroll provider platform
  • Extracting data from HR system of record & data input on to the Payroll Platform directly including: New Starters, Leavers, One Time Payments, Overtime, Salary Changes, etc.
  • Ensuring Payroll is processed accurately within agreed deadlines
  • Liaising with key business stakeholders
  • Resolving all queries from employees via Helpdesk in a timely manner
  • Sending Statutory forms to Payroll Vendor within agreed deadlines
  • Responding to HR and employees' requests and queries
  • Performing ad hoc activities related to assigned payroll group

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Payroll Specialist if your background includes:

  • Language skills - fluent English and Polish
  • Knowledge of Workday, Platnik, PUE
  • BA or MS degree preferred in finance, business management, HR or analytics
  • Interest in payroll processes, general understanding of payroll environment
  • At least intermediate level of Excel
  • Strong problem solving, decision making and analytical skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication, both oral and written
  • Proven ability to sustain strong customer relationships, an understanding of customer focus and service delivery
  • Ability to deliver results in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail
  • Drive & self motivation with the ability to work independently

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • COVID-19 Response: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
  • Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-AK1

title: Solution Architect (SAP)
description:
SAP Associate Solutions Architect

Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals worldwide make decisions that matter. As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Whether solving for today's challenges or tomorrow's aspirations, you will work with the industry's brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results. As the world's leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career.

As part of the ongoing support and enhancements to our instance of SAP S/4 Hana and SAP ECC, we're looking for an architect to guide the technology and operational decisions that will help us support and enhance technologies used by Thomson Reuters.

About the Role

In this opportunity as Architect, SAP Associate Solution Architecture you will:

  • Work with business/service owners to translate requirements into actionable architectures and with technology teams to implement them. 
  • Develop and document technical solutions for TR finance function based on SAP S/4 Hana, SAP ECC, and related technologies.
  • Research and recommend technical standards and best practices relating to SAP S/4 HANA and SAP ECC technologies. 
  • Identifying business/project risk and mitigating/communicating as needed.
  • Create and maintain a detailed view of existing architecture, to support operations and transition to future state architecture.
  • Collaborate with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, and project management in defining the roadmaps for the future of the Order to Cash and Finance technology stack at TR.
  • Continuously update yourself with next-generation technology, development tools, and contribute to development process practices.
  • Work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, consider diverse ideas, and partner with cross-functional and remote teams.

About You

  • Are an experienced SAP techno-functional lead/architect
  • Have experience with S/4 Hana implementation projects
  • Have experience in developing solution architectures across SAP and integrated systems
  • Have experience in working with diverse teams, including multi-country and company teams
  • Have experience managing or directing the work of others to contribute to a shared goal
  • Have strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Have a self-motivated, proactive mindset
  • Have an organized and systematic approach
  • Preferred – certification in TOGAF or other architecture frameworks
  • Preferred – some level of understanding in cloud architecture

title: Lead Technical Business Analysis
description:
• Responsible for elicitation, analysis, validation, and documentation of clients’ business needs and requirements.
  • Reviews, elicits, and writes formal specifications and communicates business requirements between development and client to design and implement business solutions.
  • Develops and improves business processes within the technology and business organizations and understands client requirements, specifying and analyzing these to a sufficient or expert level of detail to ensure clarity of definition.
  • Recommends and validates technical solutions to meet requirements based on understanding of how technical solutions will impact the business and stakeholders as required.
  • May work on significant & unique issues requiring evaluation of intangibles and use expertise to provide solutions to complex problems.
  • Provides technical guidance to less experienced analysts on tasks.
  • Responsible for building and maintaining a relationship with customers; may include collaborating with Professional Services & outsourcing functions.
  • Monitors and uses a structured requirements process to assess near-term needs.
  • May research and analyze current processes and recommends tools for implementation within a project department or division that meets user requirements and is cost effective.
  • Monitors and adheres to metrics to ensure customer satisfaction and recommends metrics.

  • Participates in short term planning sessions with a client to improve a business process

title: Manager of Software Engineering (Back Office)
description:
Italicized Statements apply to Individual Contributors

  • Accountable for the successful execution of technology projects including support and maintenance releases, minor functional releases and major products - with specific emphasis on Back Office and Entitlement Software Engineering principles and leading, overseeing supplier and internal resources .
  • Executes on technology strategies.
  • Primary area of influence is within own team and some influence on other teams.
  • Works with third parties to ensure delivery of outsourced work, resolves application issues, and understand product direction in order to support and implement where appropriate.
  • Evaluates and makes decisions on engagement of strategic suppliers.
  • Leads and manages the day-to-day activities of their team including supporting career development of team (objective setting, performance management, etc.)
  • Manages and supervises one or more small teams.
  • Serves as departmental focal point for staff issues, HR initiatives and requirements.
  • Implements and models a work culture that promotes development and retention of high quality staff.
  • Implements a customer-aware culture for their team, ensuring close working relationships with Product, Project Management, Technical Operations etc
  • Liaises with other technical development areas for cross assignments and exchange of staff and encourages staff movement in line with business and/or career development needs.
  • Participates in recruitment efforts for responsible technology team.
  • Accountable for delivery across multiple projects/products by providing guidance and support to project leads to assist in removing project impediments.
  • Ensures fidelity and feasibility of all projects plans and estimates.
  • Allocates and schedules resources in line with overall team, resolves conflicts, and prioritizes projects to meet the needs of the business.
  • Optimizes project deliverables to ensure that technology design fits with existing product architecture and technology strategy.
  • Manages bid process for new business to established standards, including detailed investigations into requirements, prioritization, scheduling and budgets.
  • Creates trust and credibility with stakeholders/user community and works with them to identify issues and risks that may impact them.
  • Creates an environment and workflow that ensures proactive identification of change to prevent problems, including problem resolution workflow.
  • Creates an environment and a culture that encourages immediate response to problems and sets expectations and timeframe for resolution with customers or groups managing customers, and manages escalated issues.
  • Participates in problem resolution recommendation for escalated issues.
  • Provides timely status updates for areas of team responsibilities within projects potentially including senior leaders, initiating escalation when necessary.
  • Adept at all aspects of technical communications, including using presentations technologies (e.g. WebEx, PowerPoint) and software demonstrations.
  • Encourages two-way communication with staff, peers, and business partners.
  • May contribute to the creation and execution of the communication plans.
  • Communicates across virtual teams and a globally diverse environment.
  • Contributes to compliance requirements and other governance measures.
  • Ensures self and team develop modules using disciplined processes, adhering to team/company standards and best practice guidelines, and corporate policies.
  • Ensures internal Service Level Agreements (SLAs) or other such agreements for third party support with technical areas are met.

title: Business Unit Controller
description:
Roles and Responsibilities:

• Stewardship and review of tax accounts of assigned entities for both group and local financial reporting compliance requirements.

• Maintenance of key SOX controls and SOX evidentiary requirements.

• Ensure appropriateness of controls for internal and external compliance.

• Monitor the month-end close process for assigned entities with respect to tax accounts and ensure that critical tax payments and computations and reconciliation obligations are met.

• Manage the relationship with departments of Global and Regional Tax, Business Finance, External Reporting, Internal Audit, Treasury, Finance Operations, Divisional Business Units, and external statutory auditors and outsourced professional service providers.

• Manage all tax compliance requirements for assigned entities, including:

o Oversight and review of the preparation and delivery of advance tax payments, tax returns by outsourced professional service providers or in-house tax teams.

o internal tax reporting;

o supporting tax audits, transfer pricing reviews, tax risk assessments, and implementation of tax strategies;

o Ensure all filing and reporting deadlines are met.

• Plan for and support all monthly, quarterly and year-end tax provisioning and group reporting.

• Take an active role in legal entity (or divisional) restructuring projects and acquisition or divestiture projects for the sub-region and ensure that entities and businesses either conform with or are integrated into Thomson Reuters accounting and finance controls and processes.

• Plan for and deliver all operational requirements of assigned entities within cost budgets

*Chartered Accountants(CA) Candidates are preferred

title: Assistant Controller
description:
Responsible for local statutory and tax compliance either for a Country or a group of Countries, by working closely with outsources service providers.

• Work with various business partners to ensure legal entities are accurately, completely and timely accounted for in the enterprise systems, as well as to ensure good controls of underlying processes are in place.

• Ensure the month end close in line with Thomson Reuter’s global reporting timetable, reviewing to ensure that critical accounts are reconciled to underlying documentation, that transactions are coded accurately in line with Thomson Reuters and local accounting policies.

• Analysis of all Balance Sheet and Cost accounts

• Liaise with auditors on Statutory & SOX audits • Participate in regional balance sheet and cost reviews.

• In conjunction with the Tax Department completion of tax packs, booking of tax provisions and monitoring tax accounts movements

• In conjunction with the Transfer Pricing Department review the quarterly calculation for Group books and also perform the true up Calculation for local books

• Provide support as appropriate in any tax audits as agreed with the Tax Department either directly or through 3rd party provider

title: Operations Manager - Distribution/Fulfillment Manager
description:
Core Publishing Solutions (CPS) is one of the largest book manufacturing facilities in the country. We utilize both digital and conventional offset printing to produce over 30 million hardbound, softbound and loose-leaf books annually. Our operation is a full service including a large warehouse where over 80,000 titles are stored, fulfilled and managed. CPS services Thomson Reuters’ Global Print business for Legal & Tax titles, as well as a wide variety of 3rd party book publishers and brokers.   We are looking for an experienced distribution manager to lead operations for new order fulfillment, finished goods warehousing, and raw materials receiving & warehousing. 

About the Role:                                                

  • Responsible for supporting the 100% safe strategy by demonstrating a leadership commitment to our safety program, empowering the team to ensure safe behaviors in all activities, and recognizing success.   
  • Responsible for organizing, developing, and directing the activities across a multi-shift operation  This role provides leadership to production supervisor(s), who have full-time production staff and additional contract labor reporting to them.
  • Develop talent & skill depth by carefully analyzing needs and creating tailored training plans with timelines.
  • Effectively manage talent by providing training, recognition, coaching, regular feedback, and performance reviews.
  • Lead hiring activities to maintain optimal staffing in each area, aligned with budget plans.
  • Champion Lean manufacturing operation model.  Identify and champion top opportunities for Kaizen events/improvements.
  • Drive standardization & improvement initiatives that establish the safest, highest quality, and most efficient production processes.
  • Oversee job evaluation, salary administration, promotion, discipline, and other performance-related matters.
  • Support our sales & customer account management teams in their interactions with our current & future customers.  
  • Leverage business system information to provide updates on efficiency, productivity, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Ensure Mail, Parcel & Freight carriers are meeting SLAs for contracted services.  Lead optimization activities that minimize transportation expenses while optimizing service that is aligned to customer expectations.
  • Evaluate and optimize parcel & freight expenses for customer shipments
  • Optimize the use of WMS (SAP) for efficiency & accuracy
  • Maintain, build, and modify processes to sustain or improve inventory accuracy

About You:

Education: (minimum requirements)

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent advanced education and demonstrated work experience

Experience:

  • 6+ years of progressive leadership experience, including experience leading supervisors
  • Experience in B2C warehousing & fulfillment operations

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Willingness to develop skill & acumen through rotational opportunities in other Global Print manufacturing, supply chain, fulfillment, and customer-facing operations. 
  • Knowledge of SAP and business system operations is strongly preferred.
  • Experience managing transportation and related carriers.
  • Excellent communication skills, leadership, and analytical skills.
  • Ability to build relationships at all levels, establish personal credibility and demonstrate expertise to earn a place as a valued business partner.
  • Driven to achieve results and able to work independently as well as in a team and matrixed environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to motivate people, address and resolve difficult situations and share knowledge.
  • Intermediate to strong computer skills, including MS Office products.
  • Ability to support a multi-shift operation.

What’s in it For You? 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more 
  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing 
  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking 
  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact 
  • Purpose-Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.  

  

Bonus: Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success
