title: Director Customer and Product PR
description:
Are you an experienced PR leader with a passion for technology?

Do you have knack for telling customers stories in a new and exciting way?

If so, then we may have just the role for you!

Thomson Reuters is looking for a Product PR Director to help share with our customers around the globe through the media, the strides we are taking to helping professionals to inform the way forward.

As part of a team of seasons product PR professionals, reporting into the senior director of Product PR you will be responsible for managing the external communications opportunities and risks for Thomson Reuters, specifically in relation to Thomson Reuters products, technology, and partnerships. The successful candidate will have deep communications experience in the tech and innovation industry and be confident in building bold and creative campaigns. They are as comfortable advising leaders as they are briefing journalists - working across the business to uncover proactive communication opportunities. They are well-versed in fast response, crises management and proactive communications common to a fast-growing SaaS-based organization, with a strong understanding of the levers that power successful global technology businesses.

About the Role

In this opportunity as Director Customer and Product PR, you will:

  • Create, maintain, implement, and evaluate an effective and engaging communications strategy that raises the profile of our work, ensures we are engaging with the right stakeholders, delivers our key messages and helps to progress our ambitions.
  • Constantly protect and actively position Thomson Reuters in a manner that supports and advances the corporate strategy in the right way.
  • Lead the development and implementation of a compelling product, customer and partnership PR strategy and plan in lock step with Thomson Reuters technology vision and brand strategy on a quarterly and annual basis – reviewing the plan regularly to ensure effectiveness is maximized – course corrected where needed.
  • Provide communications expertise, support, and advice to the executive team, including writing materials and/or securing appropriate input for speaker opportunities, opinion editorial, rapid response etc
  • Partnerships are a large part of our technology strategy at TR – build and define the guardrails that allow us to both use them in our PR campaigns, as well as encourage them ( where appropriate and with the right guardrails) to mention TR in their PR and social activity.
  • Leverage your extensive relationships with relevant journalists and analysts to communicate Thomson Reuters technology vision, products, and customer success.
  • Drive relationships with PR agency partners used for product, customer and partnership PR or campaigns to maximize effectiveness
  • Lead the team to project manage and implement at least one major product/launch campaign per quarter as appropriate to the wider business strategy.
  • Lead the team to be able to report effectively against their KPIs, demonstrating value to the business as well as delivery against their objectives.

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Director Customer and Product PR if your background includes:

  • Experience building and leading product communication teams in global, technology-based, SaaS organizations
  • Knowledge in driving results for technology product launches and thought leadership through use of media campaigns and effective content creation
  • Proven experience in coaching spokespeople and in supporting media outreach program at a senior executive level
  • Public company experience and familiarity in dealing with confidential/ material information
  • Excellent communication skills, additional languages advantageous
  • Must have strong relationships with business media
  • Proven ability to coordinate a global media program in a matrixed organization (working with direct and non-direct reports)
  • Experience in financial services, information services, media and or technology industries an advantage

Whist the requirements and experience needed for this role are very much desired, we appreciate you might not meet all the criteria, or have alternative skills we didn’t list. If you feel this is a role you could be successful in, please drop us a line – we’d love to speak with you.

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • COVID-19 Response: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
  • Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sr. Executive Assistant
description:
Sr. Executive Assistant

Do you have experience performing highly responsible and professional secretarial and administrative services? Are you passionate about the chance to bring your talent to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team and work directly to the highest levels of senior executives to enhance the efficiency of the business

About The Role

In this opportunity as a Sr. Executive Assistant, you will:

  • Provides professional secretarial and administrative support at the Executive Committee level, exercising confidentiality, tact, and diplomacy and providing a high level of service.
  • In-depth knowledge of subject matter expertise of own area and company policies and procedures.
  • Screens calls, manages calendars, arranges complex travel and meeting arrangements, manages expenses and mail, and deals with highly sensitive or confidential information.
  • Prepares complex and confidential documents and presentations and works closely with finance teams on forecasting revenue and expense reports.
  • Involved in conference and event organization.
  • Trains another administrative staff requires strong computer and internet research skills along with the ability to train others on system usage.
  • Requires flexibility, with excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Interacts with the most senior executives across the Company on significant matters, anticipating and responding to requests by modifying procedures to individual circumstances.
  • May work on ad-hoc projects.
  • Requires specific industry or market experience.

About You

You're fit for the role if your background includes:

  • Bachelor's Degree.
  • Excellent prioritization skills
  • Demonstrates high level of interpersonal skills and professional acumen
  • Demonstrates a high level of planning and organization skills
  • Demonstrates excellent communication skills in English
  • Exhibits a high degree of autonomy and decision-making discretion
  • Proficient typing skills and knowledge of computer applications (i.e., Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Adobe) necessary

title: Implementation Consultant - Global Trade (FTZ)
description:
Allow us to introduce ourselves. We are an enterprise software, content and services provider of Global Trade solutions – meaning, we build software to help companies manage international trade needs. Our ONESOURCE GTM software helps companies get their products across borders and into the hands of consumers like you. We’re looking for smart, creative, individuals to work directly with our customers and implement our US Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ) software.

As an Implementation Consultant, specializing in our US Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ) module, you will be provided with exciting opportunities to interface with customers & internal teams while supporting global corporations. Through this experience you will gain a greater understanding and appreciation for how corporations are being run in today’s markets.

Within this program we offer extensive training, mentoring, and guidance to start you on the path to a successful career in consulting at Thomson Reuters. You will be trained in best practices, methodologies, and gain the technical and functional skills required to participate in enterprise software projects focused on supporting  Global Trade and Compliance departments. These projects include implementation of enterprise software, content and services to our customers.  You will also be exposed to the ONESOURCE platform, and all services provided across our Corporates business.

As a member of the Professional Services team, you will strive to enable and simplify the work of professionals in Corporations focusing on Global Trade.

The Implementation Consultant will work closely with Project Managers to implement Global Trade software.  This position is part of the Corporates Professional Services department.  We deliver enterprise Global Trade, Compliance and software that provides critical information and software solutions to companies of all sizes. 

About You

In this opportunity as Implementation Consultant - (US Foreign Trade Zones), you will:

  • Interact with client Global Trade professionals in Fortune 500 clients

  • Assist in business and requirements sessions and formulate into design/solution documentation

  • Engage with other key teams such as Product Management & Engineering within Thomson Reuters as appropriate to deliver end to end solutions

  • Assist Project team to ensure all related requirements are met

  • Explain system or tool related issues/problems and solutions to Global Trade & technical staff

  • Work with clients to translate their policy into our Solutions

  • Complete tasks with limited supervision

  • Perform technical or functional roles on small, medium to large projects led by an Implementation Consultant or Project Manager

  • Act as project lead on small projects with supporting project team member

  • Support sales teams by providing scope feedback

Mandatory Experience and Skills

  • Must have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills and know how to share information professionally and concisely

  • Must be able to work effectively in a team environment

  • Proficient in working with computers and standard business software like Microsoft Office

  • Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently

  • Ability to be a self-starter

  • Creative problem-solving skills & motivated to drive innovation

  • Ability to work in a diverse work environment

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Implementation Specialist - (US Foreign Trade Zones), if your background includes:

  • 3 – 5 years relative work experience

  • Exposure to Global Trade or Supply Chain Businesses, and/or Compliance processes

  • Experience with process analysis, design & mapping

  • Experience Implementing Enterprise Software including Cloud Solutions and third-party applications

  • Licensed U.S. Customs Broker desirable, but not required

Education Required

·Higher Education Degree or Diploma – Finance, Accounting, Supply Chain, International Business or Computer Science preferred

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

#LI-BS1

title: Bangladesh Correspondent
description:
Reuters is looking for a highly motivated self-starting journalist to join the Dhaka bureau as a correspondent who will cover everything from Bangladesh’s surging needs for energy and commodities, to challenges and opportunities for its massive garments industry, and the plight of the nearly 1 million Rohingya refugees living in the country’s southeast.

As a correspondent in the small but densely populated country of nearly 170 million, the successful candidate will document the expansion of Bangladesh’s economy which has grown faster than most, but is now under pressure from rising energy prices. Its ties with regional powerhouses China and India will also be of immense interest.

About the Role

As a Bangladesh Correspondent, you will:

-- Stay on top of all major news and deliver it to Reuters clients in coordination with the South Asia Breaking News Hub.

-- Build contacts across government, industries and regional offices of global humanitarian and other agencies to deliver a rich initiatives file.

To be a Bangladesh Correspondent, you should have: 

-- A passion for news, speed and accuracy.

-- Excellent news judgment across the file. 

-- Very strong writing skills. 

-- Good communication skills and ability to work well with colleagues outside the country.

-- An ability to work calmly under pressure.

What’s in it for You?

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

-- Global Career: As a global company, we can offer you truly international career and progression opportunities.

-- Learning & Development: On-the-job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists.

-- Benefits: We offer competitive salary packages and market-leading benefits including paid volunteering days.

-- Perks: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in our operations around the world regardless of race, colour, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. title: Chief Correspondent, Switzerland & Austria – Reuters
description:
Chief Correspondent Switzerland & Austria (f/m/d),

based in Zurich, Switzerland.

We are looking for an ambitious and creative journalist with strong news judgment and a passion for storytelling to lead our reporters in Switzerland and Austria.

In this job, you would lead a team of reporters based in Geneva, Zurich and Vienna, reporting in English and German to cover top stories and generate exclusives, ahead-of-the curve analyses and smart multimedia pieces for financial clients, media and dotcom readers. The region’s file is varied, ranging from the United Nations and the World Health Organisation to Swiss banks and pharma companies to the Vienna-based International Atomic Energy Agency.

As Chief Correspondent, you would also build your own source base in the region, develop and pitch story ideas and have an ability to frame stories from the region for an international audience. You would work closely with news editors, the region’s Breaking News Hub and visuals to hit the top stories hard, and would hire, develop and retain the best and most diverse talent for the team.

As our Chief Correspondent for Switzerland & Austria, you will:

  • Ensuring a steady stream of story pitches to enrich the file out of Switzerland and Austria

  • Working with correspondents to develop and execute story ideas

  • Building and deepening a source base in Switzerland to generate scoops and exclusives

  • Managing a team of reporters

  • Writing and editing spot copy and trunks and helping to cover breaking news

  • Liaising with visuals teams to ensure stories are multimedia

  • Playing a key role in winning top timings by communicating quickly and clearly

To be Chief Correspondent, Switzerland and Austria, you will likely have:

  • An understanding of how economies work

  • Fluent English and strong German and/or French

  • Strong writing and editing skills as well as news judgment

  • An ability to work as part of a team across languages and media

  • The ability to work under pressure

What’s in it for You 

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth: 

  • An exciting work environment driven by the news 

  • A close-knit team that collaborates with Reuters journalists around the world 

  • Regular training offers on news subjects, technology and mental health issues  

  • Two mental health days per year  

  • Hybrid working options

Please note, the deadline for applications is Friday 13th January 2023.

The successful candidate will report to Sabine Wollrab, co-Bureau Chief, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Balkans

About Reuters

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news and sports news to professionals via the world's media organizations, desktop terminals, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: QA Engineer - Product Engineering
description:
About the Role  
In this opportunity as QA Engineer, you will:  

  • Write new software, make modifications to existing software, or integrate software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications provided by others.
  • Create and executes unit testing and integration testing ensuring module meets requirements.
  • Execute on provided design.
  • May provide technical support to operations or other development teams
  • Create and maintain all required technical documentation / manual related to assigned components to ensure supportability.
  • Make suggestions for problem solutions or software enhancements, which will typically be reviewed by a more senior developer.
  • Implement solutions as directed within standards.
  • Participate in project planning sessions with team members to analyze development requirements, provide design options, and provide work breakdown and estimates of work.
  • Typically work on one project at a time and as a member of the project team(s) or as part of a specialist cross-project team on multiple developments.
  • Work on smaller, minimally complex projects or a particular system or application within larger projects that requires a singular area of expertise.
  • Provide status updates for own scope of work within projects.
  • Participate in internal team and status meetings.
  • Develop software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to team/company standards and software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies.
     

About You 

You’re a fit for the role of QA Engineer if your background includes:  

  • Integration testing
  • Project planning
  • Software development process
  • Technical documents
  • Technical support
  • Selenium
  • Software Applications


What’s in it For You? 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your 

personal and professional growth through: 

  • COVID-19 Response: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.

  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking 
  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact 
     

Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Analyst - Global Trade Content
description:
​Analyst - Global Trade Content

Are you looking for a new career opportunity in Trade Content? Are you passionate about the chance to bring your talent to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? If yes, we are looking for you,

Join our team to participate in an Editorial or Content Operations team and assist in the creation and/or acquisition, preparation, and delivery of assigned content and information for creating products and product functionality in all publication media (print or electronic).

About the Role

In this opportunity as an Analyst - Global Trade Content, you will:

  • Participate in an editorial or content operations team and assist in the creation and/or acquisition, preparation and delivery of assigned content and information for creating products and product functionality in all publication media (print or electronic).
  • Be responsible for the production of a product line or process.
  • Research Trade Content Online for various countries from authorized Government Websites.
  • Interpret and convert government legislation related to DPS Sanctions and Embargoes  into Standard format/Software compatible format before loading in the system (Using MS Excel)
  • Extract the DPS Content from source and convert into standard load file (Excel) and load them into system
  • Track the daily regulatory changes from government websites for assigned Denied Party lists and update the data whenever applicable based on SLA
  • Validate the DPS data by comparing source with system data
  • Document the processes and work instructions
  • Apply technology to client needs

About You

You're fit for the role if your background includes:

  • Bachelor's Degree.
  • Fluent English is a must.
  • Recent graduates/ 1 year of experience doing similar activities.
  • Knowledge of HS and Customs regulations.
  • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.
  • Analytical, interpretation, and translation skills.
  • Strong MS Excel skills.
  • Strong focus on delivery, including attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, while at the same time fully participating in a team environment.

Location: CDMX

#LI-ZM1

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • Hybrid Work Model: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote until further notice. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.

title: Project Manager, Professional Services
description:
Are you an experienced Technical Project Manager with strong client facing skills? Thomson Reuters provides world-class solutions of professional workflow, including Banks, Legal firms, Tax departments, Supply chain departments.

We are seeking a self-motivated member to join our team, focusing on managing software implementation and professional service projects in Asia Market.

About the role

In the role of Project Manager, Professional Services, you will

  • Project management and lead consultants in implementation and integration of Thomson Reuters ONESOURCE software solutions at client sites in Japan, China, Korea and South East Asia.

  • Support the pre-sales activities from professional service side to conduct product / technology due diligence and develop standard of work (SOW).

  • Create/Review project scope, schedule, delivery plan; validate any requirements, identify project dependence, risk and issue with key project stakeholders.

  • Proactively manage the changes of project scope and customers’ expectations.

  • Lead functional & process requirement workshops with customers to define business, process, functional and data requirements, deliver Client trainings.

About You

In the role of the Project Manager, Professional Services, you should ideally possess:

  • Strong project management skills, has 5-8 years of experience successfully managing complex client facing projects.

  • Proven experience in enterprise software implementations, project life cycles and software implementation methodologies.

  • Flexibility to travel 10~20 % to customer locations.

  • Native level Japanese language skills and business proficiency in both written and spoken English.

Education / Certifications Required

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Accounting & Finance or Project Management equivalent

title: Senior Conference Producer
description:
Senior/ Conference Producer

About the role:

  • Managing the events assigned to you on a daily basis
  • Researching and producing relevant, high quality conference agendas that appeal to various levels within the Legal industry.
  • Speaker acquisition from the buy-side
  • Event marketing – these are activities that promote the event to achieve commercial success and event attendance, including and not limited to, organising eDMs, building event microsite, liaising with sponsors, partnerships with associations, etc.
  • Briefing sponsorship and telesales teams
  • Onsite logistics – CP is responsible for onsite operations for all events assigned to you.
  • Eventually, a Senior CP should be able to identify gaps in the market and developing events of various types in order to take advantage of these gaps
  • Liaising with additional teams across Thomson Reuters Asia and cooperating closely with regard to both marketing for the events and event delivery

About you:

  • Educated to degree level or higher
  • Minimum 8 years conference production / research experience;  someone who may be mid-career and ready for further development into a Conference team manager in 2-3 years
  • Able to demonstrate strong research abilities and quickly understand a wide range of topics
  • Strong telephone and interpersonal skills
  • Focus on time management and ability to focus on a number of different projects at any one time
  • Ability to work independently; a self-starter who can navigate and multitask, across project and units
  • Commercial acumen would be beneficial, some experience dealing with clients preferred
  • Knowledge of the legal industry would be advantageous

Skills required:

  • Strong research skills and experience in speaker acquisitions
  • Ability to work with sponsors, and the sponsorship team to achieve commercial success of the events assigned
  • Ability to bring along best practices and experience from previous roles
  • Strong organisational, record keeping and time management systems
  • Candidates with an open mind to pick up commercial acumen, ability to navigate in a complex and dynamic environment

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Hybrid Work Model: A hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: Systems Engineer
description:
Job Description

Thomson Reuters provides knowledge to act: we deliver information quickly and efficiently so professionals can make decisions that matter. We combine industry expertise with innovative technology to deliver critical information to leading decision makers in the legal, tax and accounting markets, powered by the world’s most trusted news organization. We aim to provide every one of our employees with a positive working environment, continued professional development and a commitment to work-life balance and equal opportunities. We are also part of a vast network of global career opportunities and actively encourage development of staff in the business.

OSP Operations is a part of Platform Organization supporting the Novus Suite, the underlying enterprise search and data retrieval platform that supports over 20 online applications across Thomson Reuters Professional and $1.9B in revenue.  The responsibility of this group is to deliver highly performing, highly available solutions that enable Thomson Reuters partners to drive continued growth of online revenue.

AMS Bangalore is a part of Novus operations team and provides support for various applications and services that come under the umbrella of Novus suite.  This team performs 3 critical support functions namely application management, incident management and change/release management. For application management function, it interfaces with application teams to ensure processes are in place to support the application, works on application configuration, facilitate creation of monitoring solution. AMS provides incident management by being primary contact for problem notifications, coordination, tracking and reporting. It utilizes diagnostic and debugging tools. It also aids in identifying problem areas within application and utilize post mortem process wherever applicable. AMS provides release management by performing feature and maintenance releases for Client and prod environments, does deployment checkouts, coordinates platform specific patches and upgrades.  

This position will provide you opportunities to collaborate with highly skilled peers in developing innovative technical solutions. The position applies industry standard requirements in a variety of technologies such as Tomcat, Coherence, Linux, Java and enterprise database technologies such as Oracle, IBM MQ etc,.

The ideal candidate will be:

  • Keen to learn complex architectures and come up to speed quickly.
  • A self learner, self driven and able to operate with minimal supervision.
  • Able to demonstrate ownership on accountabilities.
  • Able to successfully communicate with business partners, management and technical team members.
  • Proactive in raising problems and identifying solutions.
  • Strong sense of customer service.
  • Able to work in a highly collaborative team setting.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Perform change management functions involving software deployment and server maintenance requests.
  • Coordinate and plan changes with other technology teams involving servers within our environment.
  • Respond and mitigate incidents as they occur within the environment.
  • Contribute details to post incident review process.
  • Communicate and escalate customer impacting issues according to department guidelines.
  • Represent operations in a technical fashion to leadership and development teams.
  • Lead projects and engagements that evolve the stability, scalability, and supportability of the Cobalt Services environment.
  • Partner with development and other operations team to continue evolving our monitoring and operational procedures for the Cobalt Services architecture.
  • Be a customer advocate ensuring service requests are completed and assigned with the appropriate priority within the operations teams.
  • Update support documentation as needed as environment changes occur.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • College degree or technical certification.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in an enterprise level operations support role OR systems administration position.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong collaboration skills.
  • Desire to work in a fast-paced, agile based environment.
  • Working knowledge of Linux, Tomcat and Java applications.
  • Familiarity of ITIL Change and Incident management processes.
  • Familiarity with software development and QA practices (e.g. Agile)
  • Familiarity of database and networking concepts.

title: Lead Software Engineer - Product Engineer
description:
Lead Software Engineers – Equipo de Ingeniería

¿Te apasiona la oportunidad de aportar tu experiencia técnica para impulsar a nuestro equipo de ingeniería utilizando las mejores prácticas de la industria en una empresa de clase mundial? Estamos contratando 100+ Ingenieros en Software Bilingües con diferentes niveles de experiencia, para trabajar en nuestro centro de operaciones en Ciudad de México. Estamos expandiendo nuestra presencia global de Centros de Operaciones mediante el establecimiento de un nuevo Centro de Operaciones en la Ciudad de México para servir a todo el continente americano (América del Norte y LatAm) con posiciones que representan productos, tecnología, operaciones de ventas, ventas internas, servicio a clientes y finanzas. Este nuevo Centro de Operaciones se basará en los centros existentes establecidos en Asia (India y Filipinas), Europa (Polonia) y América (Costa Rica) 

Como Ingeniero en Software en Thomson Reuters, serás responsable de buscar continuamente la optimización de los sistemas y servicios de seguridad, la automatización, el desempeño y la disponibilidad, al mismo tiempo de garantizar que las soluciones desarrolladas, se apeguen a los estándares de arquitectura. Serás responsable de garantizar que los sistemas tecnológicos y los procesos relacionados se alineen con los valores organizacionales. Podrás ofrecer soluciones innovadoras que tengan un impacto en los negocios de nuestros clientes todos los días y estar en contacto con compañeros de equipo a nivel mundial para desarrollar ideas innovadoras para los mejores productos disponibles en el mercado. ¡Estamos comprometidos con el crecimiento de nuestro equipo de Ingeniería y queremos gente que este igual de entusiasmada que nosotros! 

Acerca de la posición 

En esta oportunidad como Lead Software Engineer tendrás la oportunidad de:

  • Desarrollo y entrega: Aplicar practicas modernas de Ingeniería, serás parte de todo el desarrollo, soporte operativo, monitoreo, automatización, creación, testing y proporcionar soluciones de alta calidad para el equipo de Ingeniería. 
  • Trabajo en equipo: Trabajar en un ambiente de equipo colaborativo, compartirás información, valorarás diferentes ideas y te asociaras con equipos multifuncionales y remotos. 
  • Tendrás una mente Ágil: Con un fuerte sentido de urgencia y un deseo de trabajar de forma rápida, en un ambiente dinámico, proporcionaras soluciones en plazos de tiempo estrictos 
  • Innovador: Tendrás la capacidad de probar nuevos enfoques y aprender nuevas tecnologías. Contribuirás con ideas innovadoras, crearas soluciones y serás responsable de las entregas de proyectos, de principio a fin. 
  • Comunicación efectiva: Por medio del compromiso activo, la comunicación con socios multifuncionales y miembros del equipo, comunicaras ideas de manera efectiva y colaboraras en desarrollos técnicos. 

 Acerca de ti 

Tu perfil se ajusta a nuestras funciones de Lead Software Engineer si tienes las siguientes:

  • Licenciatura en Ciencia de la computación, Ingeniería, Tecnología de la información o experiencia equivalente 
  •  7+ años de experiencia en conocimiento practico en el entorno del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software.  

Nuestro perfil Ideal debe de ser experto en: 

  • .Net/C#, ASP.Net o Java (tener experiencia en alguno de los lenguajes antes mencionados)
  • AWS 
  • Desarrollo API 
  • Contenedores (eg Docker, Kubernetes) 
  • Desarrollo UI: Angular, JQuery, JavaScript, XSLT, HTML5, XML, JSON 

Las siguientes habilidades también son deseadas 

  • Experiencia trabajando con relational databases y/o bases de datos NoSQL   
  • Experiencia práctica trabajando con desarrollo server-side JavaScript con conocimiento en creación de procesos en modern JavaScript (tests,linting,transpilation,bunduling, minification, deployment) y herramientas (Webpack, Babel, Eslint, Karma, Jasmine, Jenkins)  

Buscamos profesionales que tengan comunicación fluida en español e inglés, hablado y escrito. 

 Lo que tenemos para ti: 

En Thomson Reuters nuestro talento es lo más importante, aquí te compartimos algunos de los beneficios que ofrecemos para tu crecimiento personal y profesional. 

Nuestra cultura: Tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar en una compañía líder en el mercado tanto en contenido como en tecnología y que está apasionada contribuir a la sociedad. 

Aprendizaje y Desarrollo: Oportunidad de trabajar con una amplia variedad de tecnología de punta, cursos de aprendizaje, conferencias, eventos de networking, pláticas in-house, así como acceso a Hackathons, LinkedIn Learning, Unconferences y más. 

Paquete de Beneficios: Seguros de vida, discapacidad, Gastos médicos mayores y menores, IMSS, SAR, Vales de despensa, Prima vacacional y Aguinaldo entre otros. 

Impacto Social: Red global de voluntarios, eventos virtuales de voluntariado, 2 días pagados de voluntariado al año, la empresa aporta para donaciones caritativas y recaudación de fondos. 

#LI-DD3

Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters.   • Licenciatura en Ciencia de la computación, Ingeniería, Tecnología de la información o experiencia equivalenteIngeniero en Software 1+ años de experiencia en conocimiento practico en el entorno del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software. 
  • Ingeniero en Software Sr. 5+ años de experiencia en conocimiento practico en el entorno del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software. 
  • Ingeniero Principal en Software 7+ años de experiencia en conocimiento practico en el entorno del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software. 
  • Gerente de Desarrollo de Software 10+ años de experiencia relacionada con el desarrollo de tecnología y un sólido conocimiento del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software.

title: Software Engineer, Product Engineering
description:
• Software  Development Engineer – Product Engineering

    Are you passionate about the chance to bring your technical experience to drive our Engineering team using industry best practices in a world-class company? We are hiring 100+ Software Engineers with various experience levels for our Operations Center in Mexico City. We are expanding our global Operations Centers footprint by establishing a new Operations Center in Mexico City to serve the Americas (North America and LatAm) with roles representing product, technology, sales operations, inside sales, customer service and finance. This new Operations Center will build on the existing established Centers in Asia (India and The Philippines), Europe (Poland) and Americas (Costa Rica). 

    As a Software Engineer at Thomson Reuters, you will be responsible for continually looking to optimize systems and services for security, automation, performance and availability, while ensuring solutions developed, adhere and align to architectural standards. You will be responsible for ensuring that technology systems and related procedures adhere to organizational values. You’ll be able to deliver innovative solutions that impact our customers business every day and partner with teammates globally to develop innovative solutions for the best products in the market. We are committed to the growth of our Engineering teams and want people who are just as excited by this as we are! 

    About the Role  

    In these opportunities as a Software Engineer (Software Engineer, Senior Software Engineer, Lead Engineer, and Software Development Manager) you will:  

  • Develop and Deliver: Apply modern Engineering practices; you will be involved in the entire development, operational support, monitoring, automation, building, testing and delivering high-quality solutions for the Engineering team 
  • Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams 
  • Have an Agile Mindset:  With a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines 
  • Be Innovative: You are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries 
  • Be an Effective Communicator: Through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments 

  • About You 

    You’re a fit our Software Engineering roles (Software Engineer, Senior Software Engineer, & Software Development Manager) if you have:  

  • A Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent experience 
  • Software Engineer 1+ years of working knowledge in software development lifecycle environment  
  • Senior Software Engineer 5+ years of working knowledge in software development lifecycle environment  
  • Lead Software Engineer 7+ years of working knowledge in software development lifecycle environment  
  • Software Development Manager 10+ years technology development related experience and strong knowledge of the software development life cycle.  

  • The ideal candidate hands-on experience with: 
  • .Net/C#, ASP.Net or Java 
  • AWS 
  • API development 
  • Containerization (eg Docker, Kubernetes)  
  • UI Development: Angular, JQuery, JavaScript, XSLT, HTML5, XML, JSON 
  • The following skills are also desirable: 
  • Experience working with relational databases and/or NoSQL databases. 
  • Hands-on experience with server-side JavaScript development with an understanding of modern JavaScript build procedures (tests, linting, transpilation, bundling, minification, deployment) and tools (Webpack, Babel, Eslint, Karma, Jasmine, Jenkins) 
  • We prefer candidates to have strong written and oral communication skills in Spanish and English 

  • In addition to the above qualifications, the Software Development Manager will have the following experience: 

  • 2+ years of people management experience 
  • Experience in leading and managing projects in the software development 
  • Strong understanding of and commitment to lean product and software development values and principles 
  • Strong collaboration skills and ability to influence stakeholders at all levels in the   organization 
  • Strong bias for action, taking ownership and initiative and willing to take risks when appropriate 
  • Strong leadership presence and effective communicator. Must be able to present effectively to a wide range of audiences such as Technology leadership, business partners 
  • Active listening skills, open to learning and ideas from others; willingness to offer a point of view 
  • A strong advocate for innovation 
  • Strong inter-team communication, written and oral communication skills in Spanish and English 

  • What’s in it For You? 

    At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth: 

  • Our Culture: You will have the opportunity to work for a globally recognized company that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community 
  • Learning & Development: Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology, various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series. As well as access to Hackathons, Unconferences, LinkedIn Learning and more 
  • Benefits: Vacation Bonus, Christmas Bonus, Life and Disability Insurance, Major medical expenses insurance, Grocery Coupons, IMSS, INFONAVIT, SAR 
  • Social Impact: Global volunteer network, organized virtual volunteer events, 2 paid volunteer workdays a year, company matching for personal charitable giving and fundraising 

  • #LI-FP2

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your extensive technical experience to drive the Site Reliability Engineering team using industry best practices in a world class company? Thomson Reuters ONESOURCE Platform’s SRE team is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer who will provide hands-on technical skills and share industry best practices with other team members on core SRE principles and tools. The Site Reliability Engineer will participate in end to end operational aspects of ONESOURCE Platform Applications by working closely with Architects, DevOps, Product and development teams to ensure we get the most out of the software on AWS platform.

About the Role

In this opportunity as a Site Reliability Engineer, you will: 

  • Develop and Deliver: applying modern SRE operational & development practices, you will be involved in the entire operational support, Monitoring, automation, building, testing and delivering high quality solutions for SRE team.
  • Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams
  • Be an Agile Person:  with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines.
  • Be Innovative: you are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries
  • Be an Effective Communicator: through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments

About you:

You’re a fit for the role of Software Engineer if you:

  • Have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science discipline and AWS Certification is a plus. (AWS Sysops Admin preferred)
  • 2 plus years of experience as an SRE engineer or DevOps engineer on AWS Cloud platform.
  • Ability to work with minimal guidance or no supervision from Senior Site Reliability Engineers.
  • Demonstrate high-proficiency in automation, system monitoring, and cloud-native applications.
  • Ability to code in one of the programming languages (Java, C#, Python, JavaScript, etc.)
  • Ensure highest level of uptime, up to date Server patching and SSL certificates and implement system wide corrections to prevent reoccurrence of issues.
  • Triage, troubleshoot and resolve issues using golden signals and go past golden signals (Chaos Engineering/Gameday etc.,)
  • Create and develop documentations on Application services, infrastructure details, Recovery Procedures, Root cause analysis.
  • Proactive monitoring of the availability, latency, scalability and efficiency of all services
  • Perform periodic on-call duty as part of the SRE team on a rotational basis.
  • Experience with SQL, Windows Servers, Load balancers, Linux and AWS services such as AWS, Docker and Kubernetes, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CodeDeploy, DynamoDB, Lambda, SQS, Amazon FSX, Elastic Search and networking concepts are must.
  • Working knowledge of infrastructure components (e.g. routers, load balancers, cloud products, container systems, compute, storage, and networks)
  • Experience with tools such as Jenkins, Ansible, Github, PagerDuty, ServiceNow, Datadog, CloudWatch are required.

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology
  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one
  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks
     

#LI-DD3

title: Sr. DevOps Engineer - Product Engineering
description:
About us

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your technical experience to drive our Engineering team using industry best practices in a world-class company? We are hiring several Sr. DevOps Engineers with various experience levels for our Operations Center in Mexico City. We are expanding our global Operations Centers footprint by establishing a new Operations Center in Mexico City to serve the Americas (North America and LatAm) with roles representing product, technology, sales operations, inside sales, customer service and finance. This new Operations Center will build on the existing established Centers in Asia (India and The Philippines), Europe (Poland) and Americas (Costa Rica).

As a Sr. DevOps Engineer at Thomson Reuters, you will be responsible for continually looking to optimize systems and services for security, automation, performance and availability, while ensuring solutions developed, adhere and align to architectural standards. You will be responsible for ensuring that technology systems and related procedures adhere to organizational values. You’ll be able to deliver innovative solutions that impact our customers business every day and partner with teammates globally to develop innovatisolutions for the best products in the market. We are committed to the growth of our Engineering teams and want people who are just as excited by this as we are!

About the Role

In this opportunity as a Sr DevOps Engineer you will: 

  • Develop and Deliver: Apply modern Engineering practices; you will be involved in the entire development, operational support, monitoring, automation, building, testing and delivering high-quality solutions for the Engineering team
  • Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams
  • Have an Agile Mindset:  With a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines
  • Be Innovative: You are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries
  • Be an Effective Communicator: Through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments

About You

You’re a fit our Sr. DevOps Engineering roles if you have:

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent experience
  • 3+ years of DevOps or SRE experience including:
    • Proven ability to learn new technologies quickly
    • Proven ability to solve complex problems independently
    • Creative problem solving, troubleshooting skills and critical thinking
    • Development of solutions for a critical enterprise software n-tier web products
    • Effective time management, ability to plan and prioritize work
    • Take ownership of problems, identify solutions and drive resolution
    • Work well within a team environment and one on one
    • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written
  • Experience with Scrum framework with hands-on agile delivery experience
  • Hands-on experience with AWS/Azure cloud services
  • Excellent technical knowledge of operating systems (Linux and windows),
  • Experience in working scripting languages such as Python, GoLang, PowerShell
  • Hands-on experience with Continuous Integration tools such as Jenkins, Azure DevOps, TeamCity, GitHub Actions, Jira
  • The ideal candidate will have a background in software development in Java technologies
  • Good Understanding of ITIL framework

What’s in it For You?

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Our Culture: You will have the opportunity to work for a that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community
  • Learning & Development: Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology, various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series. As well as access to Hackathons, Unconferences, LinkedIn Learning and more
  • Benefits: Vacation Bonus, Christmas Bonus, Life and Disability Insurance, Major medical expenses insurance, Grocery Coupons, IMSS, INFONAVIT, and SAR
  • Social Impact: Global volunteer network, organized virtual volunteer events, 2 paid volunteer workdays a year, company matching for personal charitable giving and fundraising

title: Senior Sail point Engineer - Operations Information Security
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your technical experience to drive our Engineering team using industry best practices in a world-class company? We are hiring 100+ Software Engineers including Senior Sail point Engineer with various experience levels for our Shared Service Center in Mexico City. We are expanding our global Shared Service Centers footprint by establishing a new Shared Service Center in Mexico City to serve the Americas (North America and LatAm) with roles representing product, technology, sales operations, inside sales, customer service and finance. This new Shared Service Center will build on the existing established Centers in Asia (India and The Philippines), Europe (Poland) and Americas (Costa Rica). 

As a Senior Sail point Engineer at Thomson Reuters, you will be responsible for continually looking to optimize systems and services for security, automation, performance and availability, while ensuring solutions developed, adhere and align to architectural standards. You will be responsible for ensuring that technology systems and related procedures adhere to organizational values. You’ll be able to deliver innovative solutions that impact our customers business every day and partner with teammates globally to develop innovative solutions for the best products in the market. We are committed to the growth of our Engineering teams and want people who are just as excited by this as we are to join us a Senior Sail point Engineer! 

About the Role  

In these opportunities as a Senior Sail point Engineer you will:  

  • Develop and Deliver: Apply modern Engineering practices; you will be involved in the entire development, operational support, monitoring, automation, building, testing and delivering high-quality solutions for the Engineering team 
  • Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams 
  • Have an Agile Mindset:  With a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines 
  • Be Innovative: You are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries 
  • Be an Effective Communicator: Through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments 

About You 

You’re a fit for our Senior Sail point Engineer roles if you have:   

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent experience 
  • 5+ years of working knowledge in Sail point​
  • Provides a high level of technical and subject matter expertise in one or more technologies and serves as a point of escalation for technical issues related to specialty.
  • Produces, delivers, and maintains appropriate documentation for systems in accordance document control standards and procedures.
  • Provide input to records, quality systems and management reports as required
  • Contributes to the definition and implementation of improved operability on new and current systems.
  • Uses innovative methods including the redesign of process and providing technical solutions to reduce the volume and mean time to recover incidents in assigned business unit.
  • Identifies risks & issues and takes ownership to deliver appropriate resolutions.
  • Provides technical expertise for root cause analysis and problem management.
  • Provides detailed implementation/project plans across multiple, complex work streams according to agreed standards and ensures project processes and timelines are understood and followed.
  • Works and cooperates with internal and external groups when required in order to fully support environments and maintain service.
  • Adheres to change management procedures in defining, planning and implementing change in such a way that ensures appropriate coordination with other teams, minimizes service disruption, and ensures adherence to Service Level Agreements.
  • Improves change management processes and procedures to ensure the most efficient processing of change within appropriate service risk constraints.
  • Provides specialist support during complex and/or major incidents.
  • May be asked to lead recovery efforts during major incidents within business unit.
  • Deputize for the team manager as required.
  • Contributes to or author technical documentation such complex changes instructions.
  • Reviews, and updates as appropriate, operations procedures, standards, and technical policies.
  • May be asked to assist with production of white papers on technical R&D projects
  • Collaborates with business, third party vendors, developers, application support and technical operations groups to determine appropriate hardware/software needed and to resolve any issues impacting the application processes.
  • Stays abreast of recent developments in related technical community, including new technology and business news that may impact vendors’ ability to provide service.
  • Responsible to seek out all information and to fully understand all aspects of each device’s technology configuration and uses all approved engineering tools available to implement conforming change.
  • Leads the analysis and design of complex solutions and requirements definition, including translating technical and business requirements into physical installations, costing design elements, and obtaining agreement to proposed solutions.
  • Reviews and coordinates the implementation of proposed modifications, and changes to the production environment.
  • Provides direction into standards and procedures for monitoring, capacity planning, tuning, maintenance, performance optimization, backups and recovery; ensures infrastructure will meet capacity requirements to deliver projects on time.
  • Database Engineer:
  • Provides direction for: proactive health and performance monitoring of databases, indexes and logs, and troubleshooting of reported issues.
  • Reviews implemented scripts, stored procedures, and reports generated by automated database maintenance scripts.
  • Participates in the technical design process as it relates to database implementations, reviews technical documents, and communicates any risks or issues using the appropriate escalation procedures.
  • Provides directions to Technical Recovery plans (Database Standby and Replication, Backup and Recovery).
  • Platform Engineer:
  • Packages company approved hardened versions of targeted operating systems.
  • Ensures stack of agents for management systems are properly installed and connected.
  • Maintains patch levels in accordance with change management and security standards.
  • Storage Engineer:
  • Provides leadership for storage-related projects, including switch installations, disk consolidations, disk assignments, replication, and more.
  • Works closely with architecture teams to set, communicate, and maintain storage standards.
  • Network Engineer:
  • Reviews the network infrastructure documentation/ run book for standards adherence.
  • Complies with all routing and rules sets, sequences, defaults, and standards.
  • Documents and maintains all applicable configuration standards.
  • Assures all NIC and port speeds are appropriately locked down.
  • Application Engineer:
  • Fully familiarizes self with all aspects of the developed code.
  • Recognizes design problems and errors and takes corrective action from a design perspective on the object code environment. Interfaces with development teams on system design enhancements and the elimination of intermittent hardware/software problems.

What’s in it For You? 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your 

personal and professional growth through: 

  • COVID-19 Response: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022. 
  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more 
  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing 
  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking 
  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact 
  • Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.  

 
 

Compensation: Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: Business Development Executive - Reuters Events
description:
Business Development Executive - Reuters Events

This is a full-time position based in London with hybrid working available.

Are you looking for a new challenge? Want to work with a range of global brands? Looking to be part of a friendly and inclusive sales team? If so, this might be the role for you! We’re looking for a Business Development Executive to join the Sponsorship Sales team at Reuters Events, a fast-growing conferencing and events business within Thomson Reuters.

Established in 1990 as FCBI, Reuters Events was acquired by Reuters in 2019. We deliver world-class conferences and content across the globe and work with industry leaders and visionaries to provide the critical intelligence senior level executives need to make strategic decisions.

Reuters Events brings together Reuters globally trusted brand, scale and editorial excellence aligned with domain expertise. We provide content-led conferences for professionals in a variety of specialized industry sectors (such as energy, pharmaceutical, automotive, insurance, finance, legal and many more!) to complement our extensive, in-depth content. Reuters Events exists to deliver strategic business intelligence and foster the relationships that safeguard success at leading organisations worldwide.

About the Role

As a Business Development Executive you will:

  • Work collaboratively with other executives in your sector to sell sponsorship packages across a varied and global event and conference portfolio.

  • Be an active listener that's keen to offer appropriate solutions to our clients. We're consultative in our methods and are looking for someone who can thrive in this environment.

  • Enjoy learning about new markets and stay up to date with industry trends (think current affairs, technological developments and changes across industries).

  • Be adaptable. We don't need you to have sold sponsorships in the past but are looking for people who are eager to learn.

  • Be comfortable speaking with a range of senior executives at some of the world's leading brands.

  • Work closely and collaborate with our Conference Production team to establish the best audiences and maximize the success of our conferences and events.

The Person

To be our Business Development Executive, you will likely have:

  • Have excellent communication skills. We're looking for someone who's comfortable representing the Reuters brand when engaging with other industry-leading businesses.

  • Demonstrable B2B sales and business development experience.

  • A collaborative attitude. We're team players at Reuters Events and are looking for someone who can succeed both individually and within a team-based environment.

  • The desire to progress and develop your skills further. We have an excellent (uncapped!) commission scheme that rewards your achievements and are keen to grow and invest in our sales team.

  • The ability to adapt to changes in markets and articulate potential solutions to a range of stakeholders over the phone, in person and on video calls.

Please Note: completed applications must be submitted by 23:59 (GMT) on Sunday 22nd January 2023. Early applications are strongly encouraged.

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

  • Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
